result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley M.E. Lentz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DOC Balance Inquiry
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case recalled at 1:24 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Ashley M.E. Lentz in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS count #1 to Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, contrary to 943.14, a Class A misdemeanor

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Counts #1 & #2, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--Financial Management or Financial Planning class, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy or counseling as required per Agent
--Write letter of apology to Edward Meyer, submitted to Agent
--To pay $0 restitution
--To pay costs of $486 ($243 each count)
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
APPLY CASH BOND

Days credit for time already served: 1 day
Recess: 1:43 pm

Case called at 1: 16 pm.  

Defendant Ashley M.E. Lentz in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.

Court requires $2500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with Edward Meyer except for incidental contact
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Natasha Spetz

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties. 

Recess: 1:23 pm
